item.title: Delhi’s Crusading New Leader Is Sworn In
item.description: Arvind Kejriwal, swept into office on an anticorruption campaign, pledged Saturday to arrest anyone in his government who demanded a bribe.
item.dc:creator: By HARI KUMAR and GARDINER HARRIS

item.title: Fire on Indian Express Train Kills Dozens
item.description: More than two dozen passengers were killed and seven others were badly injured when an express train traveling through the center of India caught fire early Saturday.
item.dc:creator: By HARI KUMAR and GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Indian rescue personnel try to open a window of an express train that caught fire early Saturday and killed more than two dozen passengers.

item.title: Fire on Express Train in India Kills at Least 23
item.description: A fire engulfed two coaches of an express train in southern India on Saturday, killing at least 23 passengers, many of whom suffocated after the doors failed to open, officials said.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Libya Holds Four American Military Personnel for Hours
item.description: The four, who were believed to have been reviewing evacuation routes for diplomats, were released after being held for hours at the Interior Ministry.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: Leaders Say South Sudan May Be Closer to Peace Pact
item.description: Regional leaders met while both sides in the conflict were violating a cease-fire.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS KULISH and ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH

item.title: U.N. Budget Trims Staff and Spending
item.description: The United Nations General Assembly on Friday approved a budget of $5.53 billion to cover the organization’s regular operations in 2014-15, cutting it for a second successive time.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Artillery Shells Kill Mourners in Southern Yemen
item.description: The attack killed 13 people and came a day after local gunmen fought government forces.
item.category: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Libyan Government Holds 4 U.S. Military Personnel
item.description: The circumstances of the detentions, which took place about an hour from Tripoli, were not clear.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: New Tensions Cloud Deal for Okinawa Base
item.description: A congratulatory phone call between American and Japanese officials was put on hold amid fierce local opposition.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By HIROKO TABUCHI and THOM SHANKER

item.title: Bomb in Beirut Kills Politician, a Critic of Syria and Hezbollah
item.description: The blast was the first to hit Beirut’s downtown since 2005, and among the six dead was Mohamad B. Chatah, a former Lebanese finance minister and ambassador to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Mohamad B. Chatah, a former Lebanese government minister and ambassador to the United States, was said to be among the victims and possibly the target.

item.title: World Briefing | Antarctica: First Attempts Fail to Free Ship Stranded by Heavy Ice
item.description: Icebreakers sent to free a stranded Russian research ship, the Akademik Shokalskiy, off Antarctica were stopped by heavy ice within sight of the ship, officials said early Saturday.
item.dc:creator: By HENRY FOUNTAIN

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Syria: Troops Kill Dozens of Insurgents, Reports Say
item.description: Syrian security forces ambushed and killed dozens of insurgents on Friday near the town of Maaloula, north of Damascus, Syrian rebels and government television said.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD

item.title: World Briefing | Africa: Central African Republic: 2 More Peacekeepers Killed
item.description: The deaths of two African Union peacekeepers raised to 11 the number of international peacekeepers killed in less than a month.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Asia: China: City Workers Sent to Prison for Vendor’s Death
item.description: In the July episode, a watermelon seller died after the officers tried to prevent him and his wife from selling fruit in a place they were not allowed to.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: The Saturday Profile: Holocaust History, as Told by a Survivor
item.description: Laszlo Schwartz, once mostly silent about his harrowing childhood as a prisoner of the Nazis, now spends much of his time telling his story in German classrooms.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS COTTRELL
item.media:credit: Timothy Fadek for The New York Times
item.media:description: Laszlo Schwartz, a Holocaust survivor, speaks to high school students in Emsdetten, Germany, earlier this year. “My turn came for Mengele, and he asked me to make a muscle. He asked how old I am. I said 17.”

item.title: Projects Under Scrutiny Displace Istanbul’s Poor
item.description: Development projects like the ones at the center of a widening corruption investigation in Turkey have left migrants from the countryside wondering where they will go.
item.dc:creator: By TIM ARANGO
item.media:credit: Jodi Hilton for The New York Times
item.media:description: Rebuilt houses on one side of a street in the Suleymaniye district of Istanbul, and decrepit ones on the other. Government development projects “will only be for rich people,” one resident said.

item.title: The Lede: Turkish Game Show Pulled After Hinting at Corruption Scandal
item.description: A popular program disappeared from the airwaves this week after its host appeared to make a veiled reference to a widening corruption scandal.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Protesters Clash With Police in Turkey
item.description: Thousands of protesters in Istanbul called for the resignation of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan over a corruption scandal.
item.dc:creator: By TIM ARANGO
item.media:description: People tried to recover indoors after the Turkish riot police fired tear gas at antigovernment protesters in Istanbul on Friday.

item.title: Muslim Brotherhood Supporters Defy Egyptian Crackdown
item.description: Protesters marched in cities across the country following the government’s decision to declare the group a terrorist organization.
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: The Lede: Last Words From a Beirut Bombing Victim
item.description: The blast struck the heart of Beirut’s business district, killing six people, one of them a senior Lebanese politician who had been critical of Hezbollah and the Syrian government.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTINE HAUSER

item.title: Arrest Warrant for Hédiard Owner Is Revoked
item.description: A court cited only “technical violations” for the reversal, but a news report said an international warrant for Sergei Pugachev would remain in effect.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: India Finds New Methods to Punish U.S. Diplomats
item.description: The continued hard feelings over the arrest of an Indian diplomat in New York suggest that the dispute could have a long-term impact on a relationship both sides say is crucial.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Devyani Khobragade, a diplomat in New York, was arrested on charges connected to her treatment of her housekeeper.

item.title: The Lede: Freed Pussy Riot Activists Stand Firm and Shift Focus
item.description: The activists, who held a news conference in Moscow, stood by their opposition to President Vladimir K. Putin of Russia, and said they were starting a human rights organization.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTINE HAUSER

item.title: Big Spanish Labor Union Facing an Investigation on Misuse of Funding
item.description: The regional government of Andalusia contends $2.46 million in public money was spent illegally to pay for events and gifts to officials.
item.dc:creator: By RAPHAEL MINDER
item.media:description: A rally last month against budget cuts in Spain.

item.title: Markets on Edge as China Moves to Curb Risky Lending
item.description: Beijing has pledged to deliver the country’s most sweeping financial overhaul in decades, liberalizing interest rates and welcoming investment, but the effort is putting stress on the banking system.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL GOUGH and KEITH BRADSHER
item.media:description: The central bank in China allowed rates late last week and early this week to soar to unsustainable levels.
